article.headline: Western Carolina 77, Davidson 70
article.story: DAVIDSON, N.C. (AP) -- Cory Muirhead scored 23 points and grabbed seven rebounds to lead Western Carolina to a 77-70 win Saturday and snap a 19-game home winning streak for Davidson. Muirhead hit 9-of-16 from the floor and 5-of-7 from the line for the Catamounts (11-13, 5-4 Southern Conference), who were without leading scorer Antonio Russell, who was suspended one game for violating team rules. David Berghoefer added 17 points and Trey Hopkins had 15. Jason Morton led the Wildcats (13-8, 6-3) with 22 points and Brendan Winters had 16 -- scoring all but one point in the second half. Kenny Grant added 11 points and seven assists. The Catamounts led 37-31 at the break with Morton scoring more than half the Wildcats' points with 16 that included hitting four 3-pointers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
